member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.HslColor.Parse(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a HSLColor based on an integer containing color information in the rgba format.
member.param: The color in rgba.
member.returns: Returns a new instance of HslColor.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.HslColor.Parse(System.Windows.Media.Color)
member.summary: Creates a HSLColor based on an integer containing color information in the rgba format.
member.param: The color in rgba.
member.returns: Returns a new instance of HslColor.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.HslColor.Parse(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a HSLColor based on byte array containing color information in the rgba format.
member.param: The color in rgba.
member.returns: Returns a new instance of HslColor.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.HslColor.ToInt
member.summary: Converts this HslColor instance to int in the rgba format.
member.returns: Returns an integer.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.HslColor.ToColor
member.summary: Convertes this HslColor to Color.
member.returns: Returns a color object.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.HslColor.ToRGB
member.summary: Converts this HslColor instance to a byte array in the rgba format.
member.returns: An byte array.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PivotSlider.OnTap(System.Windows.Input.GestureEventArgs)
member.summary: Called before the System.Windows.UIElement.Tap event occurs.For information on using gestures on Windows Phone, see How to handle manipulation events for Windows Phone.
member.param: Event data for the event.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PivotSlider.OnApplyTemplate
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, is invoked whenever application code or internal processes (such as a rebuilding layout pass) call System.Windows.Controls.Control.ApplyTemplate(). In simplest terms, this means the method is called just before a UI element displays in an application. For more information, see Remarks.

member.summary: A virtual callback that is called when the Value property changes.
member.param: The new property value.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TextUIControl.MeasureOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Provides the behavior for the Measure pass of Windows Phone layout. Classes can override this method to define their own Measure pass behavior.
member.param: The available size that this object can give to child objects. Infinity (System.Double.PositiveInfinity) can be specified as a value to indicate that the object will size to whatever content is available.
member.returns: The size that this object determines it needs during layout, based on its calculations of the allocated sizes for child objects; or based on other considerations, such as a fixed container size.
